structure:Concept.structure:Name: Age group
structure:Concept.structure:Description: Age - or age range - of the individuals the observation refers to.

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Footnotes
structure:Concept.structure:Description: Additional information on specific aspects of each observation, such as how the observation was computed/estimated or details that could affect the comparability of this data point with others in a time series.

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Frequency
structure:Concept.structure:Description: Indicates rate of recurrence at which observations occur (e.g. monthly, yearly, biannually, etc.).

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Location
structure:Concept.structure:Description: Refers to a disaggregation within the Reference Area the data alludes; normally National (total), Urban or Rural - although additional disaggregations are possible within an area (e.g. subUrban).

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Nature of data points
structure:Concept.structure:Description: Information on the production and dissemination of the data (e.g.: if the figure has been produced and disseminated by the country, estimated by international agencies, etc.)

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Reference Area
structure:Concept.structure:Description: Reference Area: Specific areas (e.g. Country, Regional Grouping, etc) the observed values refer to. Reference areas can be determined according to different criteria (e.g.: geographical, economic, etc.).

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Series
structure:Concept.structure:Description: The phenomenon or phenomena to be measured in the data set. The word SERIES is used for consistency with the term used in the MDG Database. SERIES are all the official MDG series and background series currently in the MDG Database.

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Sex
structure:Concept.structure:Description: Gender condition: male or female. This dimension applies only if data can be dissaggregated by sex.

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Source details
structure:Concept.structure:Description: Information on the name and specific details of each observation's data source. Both the sources for the numerator and denominator could be specified here.

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Source type
structure:Concept.structure:Description: Type of data source: survey, administrative records, census or other. Details about the source, if available, could be provided in the free-text attribute SOURCE_DETAIL.

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Time period details
structure:Concept.structure:Description: When TIME_PERIOD refers to a date range, this attribute is used to provide METADATA on the actual range the observation refers to (e.g. for period '2001-2003' TIME_PERIOD would be 2002 but the actual dates --2001-2003-- would be expressed here).

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Time period
structure:Concept.structure:Description: Reference date - or date range - the observed value refers to (usually different from the dates of data production or dissemination). For MDG data exchange it is usually expressed as a four-digit year (e.g.: 1995) so, if the observation refers to a period of time (range), details about such period should be specified in the attribute TIME_DETAIL

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Units of measurement
structure:Concept.structure:Description: Dimension by which the series are described (e.g.: percentage, USD, etc.)

structure:Concept.structure:Name: Unit multiplier
structure:Concept.structure:Description: Exponent in base 10 that multiplied by the observation numeric value gives the result expressed in the unit of measure.

Concept.Name: Contact point in international agency
Concept.Description: Provide information of person (or generic e-mail addresses of contact points) to be contacted by users for additional information.

Concept.Name: Contact name
Concept.Description: The name of the contact points for the data or metadata

Concept.Name: Contact job title
Concept.Description: The area of technical responsibility of the contact, such as "methodology", "database management" or "dissemination".

Concept.Name: Contact organisation unit
Concept.Description: An addressable subdivision of an organisation

Concept.Name: Contact organisation
Concept.Description: The name of the organisation of the contact points for the data or metadata.

Concept.Name: Contact mail address
Concept.Description: The postal address of the contact points for the data or metadata

Concept.Name: Contact phone number
Concept.Description: The telephone number of the contact points for the data or metadata.

Concept.Name: Contact fax number
Concept.Description: Fax number of the contact points for the data or metadata

Concept.Name: Contact e-mail address
Concept.Description: E-mail address of the contact points for the data or metadata

Concept.Name: Contact website
Concept.Description: Website(s) of the contact points for the data or metadata

Concept.Name: Definition of the MDG official indicator or background series provided
Concept.Description: Describes the basic definition and includes references to standards and classifications and clarification of technical terms included in the definition.

Concept.Name: Method of computation
Concept.Description: Describes the algorithm used in the calculation of the indicator, providing the mathematical formula (if applicable). Identifies all statistics used to derive the indicator such as normalizing and weighting variables (for instance, the population). List different methods used by country or agency to compute the indicator and includes hyperlinks to references to the agency methodology if available.

Concept.Name: Comments and limitations
Concept.Description: Describes comments and limitations of the indicators including issues such as: comparability, sex disaggregating if applicable, presence of wide confidence intervals (such as for maternal mortality ratios). Provides further details on additional non-official indicators commonly used together with the official MDG indicator.

Concept.Name: Sources of discrepancies between global and national figures
Concept.Description: Describes the main reasons for discrepancy between data and metadata used for national and global monitoring to improve understanding by users of the differences between country-level data disseminated through the MDGs global database and those available in country MDGs databases.

Concept.Name: Process of obtaining data
Concept.Description: Describes the mechanism for gathering data from countries including: (i) the government counterpart at the country level; (ii) description of the existing process of validation and consultation with countries. Describes the process of adjusting country data to allow international comparability. This includes adjustments such as: to a standard classification, age group or to comply with a specific international definition.

Concept.Name: Treatment of missing values
Concept.Description: Describes the process and provides the mathematical formula to produce the estimates for the indicator when country data are not available.

Concept.Name: Data availability
Concept.Description: Describes (a) country coverage; (b) universe/population of interest; (c) time lag between reference year and actual production of data series; (d) overview of frequency of data production.

Concept.Name: Regional and global estimates
Concept.Description: Provides the mathematical formula and describes the method used for the calculation of the regional/global aggregates from the country values. Specifies what types of weights are used for aggregating country indicator values to regional level.

Concept.Name: Expected time of release
Concept.Description: Provide the expected calendar of release for new data for each indicator, by the specialized agencies.

MetadataStructureDefinition.Name: Metadata Structure Definition for CountryData Indicators

IdentifierComponent.Name: Code of the CountryData indicator for which metadata is provided
Code of Reference Area for which metadata is provided
